data.title: Threaded navmesh generation
data.body:
Hello, 

Is it technically possible to put the tiled navmesh generation in another CPU tread so it can be used in large open world based games where the navmesh tiles need to be generated / regenerated / removed on the fly to save memory ? Threaded navmesh building is a must have in my opinion :)

Is there anything that could prevent this feature to be added , Im not very familiar with threading rules in the engine...

data.title: Implement UI/ProgressBar
data.body:
Urho have scrollbars, sliders, but not ProgressBar for doing some loading screens, for example.
We have this progressbar working on our project and wanting it to be upstream, then enjoy

data.title: Implementing RibbonTrail
data.body:
This is implementation for ribbon trail on Urho3D. I've implemented two types of trail, face camera and bone type. Face camera trail is always facing camera just like billboard. Bone trail will emit trail between child and it's parent, it's pretty useful for sword slashing effect. I've been adding column option too to minimize artifacts. Also, I add new sampe 44_RibbonTrailDemo to show you the effects. The commits are still messed up, I'll rebase them soon.

Face camera Trail:
![face_camera_trail](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5253453/15984497/92b5d1ae-2ff7-11e6-8d1f-113f0fff8c07.png)

Bone trail:
![bone_trail](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5253453/15984499/953d8ffc-2ff7-11e6-9a4b-efa9c0a45aa6.png)

Anyway, RibbonTrail icon for editor is still sucks, I'm not that good at pixel art. If you can to make better one, feel free to contribute. :smile:

data.title: Codestyle: long lines
data.body:
I know that it is quite strange question, but..
What's the point of very-very-very long lines?

Here is the whole function with two lines of code is written in one line.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8576192/15984480/5e0286ea-2fd5-11e6-9742-7c7208d738d5.png)

However, this is not the "put-anything-in-one-fuckin'-line" rule.
I see a lot of places with another style.

What is the right way to format code?

data.title: usleep() is obsolete, use nanosleep() instead
data.body:
Tried out an Emscripten build of latest today, and noticed that the build fails on `usleep`. The location https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/1e2baf7d7f7c392d6f8f8acb0444a73823297451/Source/Urho3D/Core/Timer.cpp#L185 calls to `usleep`. In documentation http://linux.die.net/man/3/usleep it is stated

```
4.3BSD, POSIX.1-2001. POSIX.1-2001 declares this function obsolete; use nanosleep(2) instead. 
POSIX.1-2008 removes the specification of usleep().
```

The function `usleep` is not declared in Emscripten system headers by default, but it is under a special #ifdef. `nanosleep` is readily available.

data.title: fixed size slider bug
Mouse visibility issue
Update to SQLite 3.13.0
data.body: The urho3d sqlite implementation is old. Current implement is 3.13.0

data.title: fix a typo in UTF16 decoder
Multithreaded compilation for Visual Studio
data.body:
Visual Studio is able to compile code in several threads.
Unfortunately, VS by default uses only one thread.
Unfortunately x2, it is needed to manually enable this flag for each project.
To enable this feature it is needed to add compiler option '/MP' for each source file.
Can you enable multithreaded compilation for Visual Studio?
Or can you at least tell me where should I add this option to set it globally?

data.title: Add O_HEXAGONAL type of 2D Map
data.body: This patch implements hexagonal type of 2D Map, so that it provides possibility to work with the hexagonal maps from Tiled Map Editor.

data.title: Emscripten AngelScript support
data.body:
I believe it's in a working state, though I've only tested with the 12_PhysicsStressTest.as example. 
- Has been tested by running Urho3DPlayer with the 12_PhysicsStressTest script (the file copied in place of NinjaSnowWar.as, which I hard-coded into the player, as it didn't work for me with the CommandLine.txt)
- built with "-std=gnu++14 -I/usr/include/boost" for the CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS and "-I/usr/include/boost" for the CMAKE_C_FLAGS.
- /usr/include/boost contains a symlink pointing to itself so that boost/preprocessor files can be found, without interfering the different emscripten system includes
- Networking still doesn't work, so NinjaSnowWar shouldn't work
- Debug builds did not work for me: see http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic2151.html
- Defining FORCE_AS_PORTABLE can be used to force it to use the generic build with, for example, a gcc build (which should allow more apples-to-apples testing of the efficiency of the bindings) (I have not done such tests yet).
- Discussion of this work originally at http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic2044.html

data.title: Can't use as external lib
data.body:
Hello!
I try to use Urho3D as external library on my ArchLinux, but when I compile the project, i get the error:

```
Input/InputEvents.h:28
SDL/SDL_gamecontroller.h: No such file or directory
 #include <SDL/SDL_gamecontroller.h>
```

This file is really not in SDL folder -- it's placed in SDL2 folder. Surprisingly, but Urho and samples built successfully.

data.title: Possibility to choose Graphics backend at runtime
data.body: Would be nice to separate graphics backend and allow the possibility to choose on Windows platform DirectX, OpenGL or even Vulkan in the future, now we can compile only one backend per library.

data.title: Integrate LeapMotion in Urho3D
data.body:
Hi,

I've been going through the issues to find some sort of way to get involve. Thought the VR integration describe in #153 looked super fun but I don't have an headset at this moment. What I've thought we could do is add LeapMotion which could be a cool thing to use inside the engine. Using it with VR brings out cool hack experience as I have seen on the leap motion hackathons. 
I'll be waiting for you guys to see what you've got to say about this.

data.title: Input::GetScancodeFromKey returns 0
data.body:
When trying to get the scancode from character keys like `Urho3D::KEY_A`, `Urho3D::KEY_B`, etc.. `SDL_GetScancodeFromKey()` returns 0 because it understand lowercase character keys while Urho3D uses uppercase for them.

A solution would be to replace Urho3D key constants with `SDLK_*` equivalent for them but I don't know if this introduces some other issues.

data.title: Make escape key name consistent between keycode and scancode.
